intro: Racosperma mooreanum, commonly known as the Moorean wattle, is a flowering plant native to the island of Réunion in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow floral spikes. The plant features bipinnate leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in open habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
